conclusion: Analyze the flow of liquid through the baffles to predict which container it will flow into.
Identify the starting point of the liquid flow indicated by arrows labeled A, B, C, and D.
Observe the direction of the liquid flow from points A, B, C, and D following the arrows.
Determine which container (E, F, or G) the liquid will flow into based on the path through the baffles.
Liquid flows from A, B, C, and D into the container directly connected to these points.
From the image, the path of the liquid starts from point A and flows into container E.
Verify that the flow continues through points B, C, D and ends at container E.
Conclude that the liquid will flow into container E after passing through the baffles.
